message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient likely suffered from opioid overdose, as evidenced by the constricted, non-reactive pupils and decreased respiratory rate. Naloxone is an opioid antagonist that can be given to reverse the effects of opioids and improve breathing. Ethanol is not a treatment for opioid overdose, although it can be given to treat alcohol poisoning. Methadone is an opioid agonist used for opioid dependence treatment. Atropine is a muscarinic antagonist used to treat bradycardia and other cholinergic symptoms, but is not used for opioid overdose.
